title: Calories in a Bottle of Wine
meta_description: Discover calories in bottle of wine: a standard 750 ml bottle has about 625 kcal, plus carbs, alcohol notes, and variations by type.
h1: Calories in a Bottle of Wine
assumptions: Standard 750 ml bottle of dry table wine (red or white), ~12% ABV, no added sugars.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by wine type (red/white/sweet), alcohol content, brand, and serving size. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A standard 750 ml bottle of dry wine provides ~625 kcal, mostly from alcohol.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in a bottle of red wine?
faqs.a: About 625 kcal for a standard 750 ml dry red wine.

faqs.q: Calories in white wine bottle vs. red?
faqs.a: Similar; both ~625 kcal for dry 750 ml bottles, varying slightly by sweetness.

faqs.q: Does wine have carbs or protein?
faqs.a: Dry wine has ~20 g carbs (mostly sugars) and negligible protein (~1 g) per bottle.

faqs.q: Why are calories in wine high?
faqs.a: Primarily from alcohol (7 kcal/g) and residual sugars; ~12% ABV contributes most.

faqs.q: How does bottle size affect calories?
faqs.a: Calories scale with volume; a 375 ml half-bottle has ~313 kcal, 1.5 L ~938 kcal.
